ratings.comment: class isnt too bad at all. time consuming but exams are pretty easy. lab blows but its a small part of grade. just read the book and youll be fine. hamers is great

Nice lady. Terrible project lab that takes up 90% of your life and has little to do the rest of the course. Homework can be time consuming. The concepts and material for the class are easy. The ridiculous amount of "busy" work reduces time that can be spent on any other class.

Challenging exams and homework, lots of studying required. READ THE BOOK! Very helpful to read every chapter it is the best way to grasp the concepts in addition to the homework problems. Very helpful professor outside of class and always willing to help.

Hard class. Chances are pretty good you'll be frustrated once or twice while doing homework or labs for this class. If so, go to her office hours! She is so helpful and will talk you through everything. She really cares that we understood what we were learning. Honestly, she's adorable and one of the nicest and most approachable profs I've had!
Makes me feel like a happy 3rd grader all over again. lots of work but definitely the best of the analytic teachers.

Professor Hamers is an adorable and great professor for Chem 103. Her homeworks are based on effort and her quizzes are pretty fair. The exams are not too difficult if you keep up with lecture materials and if you do the homework. She gives you a 4*6 notecard for each exam. I really recommend her.

Hamers was an awesome professor! Granted, the exams were sorta hard, but She used the class average on the exams and set that as a B, which helped a lot of students. Her lectures were clear. And she was very helpful! Take her if you can!
Hard tests

really nice lady and best prof ive had yet. i never liked chem in hs but that has changed after taking her class. overall fair grader, makes chem interesting, and really cares about her students. TAKE HER

Dr. Hamers is a good professor. You can tell she really likes Chemistry, and is a pretty good teacher. She does make a lot of silly mistakes, but corrects herself most of the time. Overall, she is a fair, fun professor for Chem 103.

This class has weekly homework and quizs which are easy if you read the book and do your homework. Test can be hard but she gives you 2 practice exams from pervious semesters and you get a NOTECARD!! She curved our class and with a 80% I got a AB in the class.

Prof. Hamers loves teaching chemistry and she is always willing to help. She is always looking for ways to improve her teaching, and she is an overall great professor. Her tests are fair; make sure to watch out for the exceptions to rules! Chem is hard but it is a good class to take with Hamers.

Great professor! Loves chemistry and teaching. Always looking for ways to improve her teaching methods. The class is challenging--there is alot of material and will be difficult for students with little chemistry knowledge (like all the chem classes at the uw). Very doable. Curve lowers to about 75 and up being an A. Tough quzzes and exams.
She might go quickly, but she will always help if you need it.
Really good prof. She cares about students and has a great interest in chemistry. learn a lot from her class
Jeanne Hamers is an fantastic professor.  She's SO enthusiastic about chemistry. I enjoyed going to her class everyday.  Take her if you can!

Tests are fair. Be sure to know the exceptions. She loves to test on them. Be sure to watch your sig figs if necessary. They only thing I did not like was that all of her definitions and other things put up on the board could be taken straight out of the book.

Dr. Hamers is a great prof, but she is a bit of a space case.  I enjoyed her antics though and I definitely learned a lot.  My TA was super tough but that only caused me to get more out of the class.  Make sure you know all exceptions to everything rule/reaction etc.  The book really isnt needed, I got an AB with out it.

Hamers is incredibly helpful and cares a lot about her students.  She is very fair and is always willing to help students outside of class.  The midterm exams were not too difficult, but the final was very hard.  Study!! If you get a difficult TA expect poor lab and quiz grades, but Hamers will curve according to sections.  Take her! she is great!

For an intro chem course, this is very hard. I spent more time on chem than my math222 and got a worse grade. my TA was extremely tough grader (which didn't help) and some quizes/exams were really hard w/ problems we never went over in class. Prof. Hamers is very willing to help. She holds review sessions before exams but they're not that much help

Prof Hamers is very nice and has pretty interesting lectures w/ great demos, but her exams are really hard. First few quizes are easy, but when most pple in class do well on a quiz/exam, expect the next quiz/exam to be incredibly hard w/ problems you've never done before. Labs are nothing like the class, and if you have a terrible TA, good luck.
super nice! willing to help. I loved her!

Professor Hammers is a very competent professor who loves what she does.  She grades fairly and has absolutely no problem helping someone out when they're having trouble.  You will never find a nicer person.  Overall I'd definitely recommend her.

Professor Hamers is an excellent teacher- her explanations are always very clear and she is super organized. She truly loves what she does and shows it through the enthusiasm she brings to class everyday. I would highly recommend her to anyone.

Professor Hamers is a really nice woman and clear in her lectuers.  Attendance is not mandatory but is essential to getting a good grade. Her exams are very hard though.  She tends to throw in curveballs, giving types of problems that haven't been previously presented in homework/lecture/discussion.  Overall,difficult exams but good lecturer.

Hamers is fine as a professor. Exams and quizzes were very similar to other profs, she never has challenge problems, as  some do. Personally, I do not like her though; she is not really that smart for being a professor and seems to make a ton of mistakes on such basic chemistry. Students catch many mistakes. READ THE BOOK!! Exams have similar probs

At first I hated her because I hated the material but laterr found her to be the best professor I've had in a long time. Explains material very well and grades fairly. Study practice exams and you will do just fine. Shes GREAT!
I love this professor!

FANTASTIC professor! Clear and concise lectures. 327 is just more in-depth than 109. Homework is good practice for the exam. Straightforward of expectations and what you need to know. Very helpful too! Exams are easy. Just make sure you keep everything straight. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. Dr. Hamers is awesome!
VERY nice lady, but not the best teacher and hard to understand. I had THE best TA which is the only reason I got a B. Exams are VERY hard, quizzes are very easy. Exams are way different.

Not the best lecturer, she relied a lot on her notes. Overall, not a bad class though and I would definitely recommend taking her over the other options for 103. Tests included a lot of exceptions but overall grading was pretty generous and fair.

Probably my best college professor thus far.  She may not be a genius when it comes to chemistry but she is a great teacher.  I actually learned from her.  Very helpful and wants the best for each of her students.

She lets you use a 4x6 note card on the exams and three on the final.  Always is trying to make exams reasonable for students but obviously you have to study... your in college now. Make sure you learn the exceptions because they are almost always on exams but that can be to your advantage if you make sure to study exceptions.  Nice person
Very very nice lady. By far the most hw out of any 103. Exams are extremely difficult. She puts at least 2 problems that are unlike any problems you do in hw. confusing to follow in lecture.

Jeanne is nice, but she doesn't seem to know how to teach. She teaches straight out of the book and commonly makes mistakes. Supposedly shes useful in office hours, I never went to them. If you are a freshman, she will seem like a good prof, but shes not. Exams were tough, but if you study enough of the book like I did, you can get an A.
Good Teacher.

If this class isn't required for your major, DON'T take it! First of all, the exams are ridiculous. They basically cover pointless information, things we've never done before, and all of the 'exceptions' to the rules we learn. Don't be fooled by the online practice exams...they're so much easier than the ones she actually gives.  A lot of things th

Dr. Hamers is a great chem prof. A good TA helps but mine wasn't that great and i'll still get at least an AB in the class. She cares a lot for her students and is willing to take the time to help her students succeed. Tests usually have one tricky problem but the curve makes up for it. TAKE THIS CLASS. She's a lot easier than other chem 103 profs!

She is a VERY nice person but she isn't a very good prof. She just repeats what is in the book and she goes WAY too fast and doesn't make any sense. Her tests are absolutely RIDICULOUS. Make sure you know all of the exceptions to rules because she gets a kick out of tricking her students. If you have an awful TA, good luck getting by in her class.

Not a bad prof; she's very nice. The exams REALLY screwed me over. The actual exams were at least ten times harder than the practice exams, which she gave LAST YEAR. Although I did poor on those, the quizzes are cake and she really will listen to whatever you have to say, and TA counts for a lot. So if you get a good one, you're golden. Otherwise..

Seems like a very nice lady, dedicated to the subject in which she teaches. It seems that most of her lectures are directly from the text, adding little extra explanation. You will need to rely on your TA a lot, and if you have a bad one,expect trouble. The exams are kind of tricky, usually containing a problem or two that youve never done.

Solid professor.  She tends to be unorganized, makes little mistakes, and cover material way too fast, but overall was helpful.  I had a HORRIBLE TA, so if you have a good one, this class could be high qual.  It not, I'm sorry-try and scrape by with a C.

She is one of the most dedicated professors I have ever met. She tends to make her classes have an unbelievably high level of work, but she is willing to spend as much time with her students as is required to get them to master the material. Students come away from her classes with a wealth of knowledge.

She's very nice, but lectures are confusing. My TA was a life saver for our class. Go to the TA review session before exams. It helps a lot more than even going to lecture. Hamers can be pretty absent minded, so just make sure you read the book and go to your TA for help. Doesn't give enough time on exams and throws in curveballs. Mostly good prof.

she's a great prof. she's probably the SWEETEST lady you will ever meet. Always listens to what students have to say and takes it into account. Tries to improve her teaching in any way she can. she's extremely fair. Sometimes she can be all over the place, i had a good TA though.

Great professor, nicest person ever.  329 is a very difficult class, long homeworks, two lab reports a week, and exams are pretty difficult.  If you work hard and go into office hours a B is attainable.
Nicest professor ever. Hard class. Hard tests. Too many labs. Bad project lab. VERY TIME CONSUMING. Very helpful during office hours. Did I mention she is nice?
Very easy A for 103. Class averaged around an 80% on midterms and she still curved the grades at the end. Of all the 103 instructors you should try to get her

Very good teacher! If you need an A take her. Lectures are helpful and previous exams, if u bother to do them are helpful. Just attend classes and discussions. A very nice lady and is always willing to listen to u. Nothing is out of the book or lectures really and the TAs will prepare u well too.

This course is difficult! If you want to suceed in this class you have to work extremely hard. There are long labs, really difficult homeworks, and tough exams. In my opinion Dr. Hamers is a great prof. She truly cares about the success of her students and is really  helpful during office hours. If you have to take 329, take it w/ Dr Hamers!

Class is hard and time consuming. Lot of homework. Exams usually make you run out of time. But Dr. Hamers would do anything to help you out. She extends her office hours as much as possible. She immediately answers every single email questions. And she visits labs often to help students. She tries her best so if you do also you can get an A.

An excellent professor. Lectures were useful and informative, homework was the easiest of any 103 secion, Quizzes were fairly easy and drawn mainly from HW problems and the lowest quiz score and HW score were dropped. Probably one of the easiest 103 professors. If you can take her section do it.
First time teaching 103 so she was kind of eratic and all over the place. Was very willing to help and liked feedback. Practice exams didn't help because they weren't hers.

Class was ok, not too boring.  At least 1/3rd of the end-of-class demo's involved explosions, and on more than one occasion she compulsively threw in more chemicals than were needed to make it even bigger.  Quizes are fairly easy if you do the HW, but the exams are really long-- she refuses to shorten them even when half the class never finishes.

Very nice professor, extremely helpful and is always very open to students questions, homework is helpful and pretty easy, exams are fairly easy as well, lecture is boring at times but its chem what can you expect, she does make some mistakes but catches them almost right away, i would recommend her to any student taking chem

Professor Hamer is a very intelligent woman, but lecture is confusing as she makes many mistakes. This is her first time teaching the class though, so it's understandable. Overall, she's a very nice woman who's very willing to help.

If you have to take Chem 103, I strongly recommand you to take it with Dr.Hamers. She is ALWYS willing to hear things from students and help her students. Go to class, discussion, and especially Fri session! Exams are fair.

She makes many mistakes in class but clearly tries her best.  Because she is new, she has trouble determining how long and difficult to make exams but will get better with practice.  She has already improved.  She is a very nice person and cares about the grades and opinions of her students.  Chem is challenging in general, but I like her.

She is a really nice professor who cares a lot about her students. She is very helpful if you go to office hours or set up an appointment. She also likes to have fun in lecture... her demos always make you laugh.

Dr. Hamers is always nice and friendly and it is obvious that she cares about the success of her students. She is ALWAYS available for students to ask questions and is more than happy to help. Exams are for the most part, very fair.
Lots o mistakes. hope you're good at teaching yourself.
New professor, not the most confident professor, makes mistakes on exams, beware!
She's great and can be fun in lecture. Really helpful with the optional q&a lecture on fridays
good
No Comments

Chem 327 is very hard and very time consuming.  Two labs a week, pre-labs, lab tests,  very difficult homework, very difficult exams.  However after taking the course my lab technique is flawless.  Very tough though.  The book is useless making it absolutely mandatory to go to lecture in order to pass.  None of the TAs spring 2007 spoke English.
Avoid taking this class if possible.  2 labs a week + hard exams + no lab partners + prelabs + postlabs + long homeworks = very little time for anything else.
